actions.committee: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

official_title: A bill to amend the Agricultural Act of 1949 (7 U. S. C. 1421 et seq.) to require that the label on each loaf of bread disclose the cost to the manufacturer of the farm product ingredients.

summary.text: Bread Labeling Act - Amends the Agricultural Act of 1949 to require that every loaf of bread in packaged form distributed in interstate commerce shall bear a label specifying the cost to the manufacturer of the farm product ingredients of the bread. Permits the Attorney General, at the request of the Secretary of Agriculture, to seek an injunction or restraining order in the appropriate U.S. district or territorial court for violations of this Act. Imposes civil penalties for knowingly violating of this Act.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Agricultural Act of 1949 (7 U. S. C. 1421 et seq.) to require that the label on each loaf of bread disclose the cost to the manufacturer of the farm product ingredients.
